title: Feat: What do you think about adding a Rust language server to Remix IDE?
body:
Gm!
Are you going to support Rust on Remix IDE?

We are the [DSRV-based WELLDONE Studio Team](https://welldonestudio.io/), and provide web3 developer tools.
While other networks lack comparable development tools, Remix IDE is only accessible on EVM, whereby there has been a big need from many communities outside EVM to have development tools like Remix IDE.
In order to support the Remix IDE in addition to the EVM network, we are creating a multi-chain builder plugin. ([beta version link](https://docs.welldonestudio.io/code))
However, we're hopeful that the Remix IDE will include Rust grammar/syntax checking as well as these other networks often use Rust to construct contracts.
The Monaco editor of the Remix IDE will thus have a Rust language server integrated into it. 
If Remix IDE supports Rust, there will be a variety of Rust-based plugins accessible.
Can we be permitted to contribute by creating this component?

Your opinion is needed on Remix IDE's graceful transition to a multi-chain IDE!

@yann300  @joeizang 

We want monaco-editor inside Remix IDE to offer grammar checking and linting for the Rust language. I want to add six significant providers to this.

1. Register a definition provider (used by e.g. go to definition).
2. Register a document highlight provider (used by e.g. highlight occurrences).
3. Register a reference provider (used by e.g. reference search).
4. Register a hover provider (used by e.g. editor hover).
5. Register a completion item provider (use by e.g. suggestions).
6. Register a signature help provider (used by e.g. parameter hints).

@yann300  @joeizang 

Hi!  we are testing the functionality of adding a Rust language server to the Remix IDE. The following is how we organized our thoughts.

1. Use [rust-analyzer](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-analyzer) to develop linting and grammar checking techniques for the Rust language and generate a package using wasm-pack.
2. Using the file included in the wasm package, I'll construct a rust-language-provider to be injected into the monaco editor [like this](https://github.com/ethereum/remix-project/blob/master/libs/remix-ui/editor/src/lib/providers/hoverProvider.ts).

Since Chrome 92, we must specify the "Cross-Origin-Embedder-Policy" setting in order to use SharedArrayBuffer in this procedure. ([Associated link](https://developer.chrome.com/blog/enabling-shared-array-buffer/)). Therefore, I believe we should change `apps/remix-ide/webpack.config.js` for this.

This is the predicament we are in, and I'm curious to see how the discussion over adding this feature is going! :)
